description: Concatenate Column Values Into a Comma Separated String (STUFF-CSV)
body:
SELECT STUFF(
				((SELECT ', ' + $table_alias$.$column_name$
				FROM $schema_name$.$table_name$ AS "$table_alias$"
				FOR XML PATH(''), TYPE).value('.', 'NVARCHAR(MAX)')), -- CSV Expression will Append to Initial Expression
				1, -- Initial Expression Start Position
				2, -- Replacement Length
				'' -- Initial Expression
			) AS "$column_alias$"

/* ===== ** Examples ** ================================================================================================================= */
--$BeginRegion: Normal Stuff Function
----> Slow and Costly Due to Type Conversion => ** Performance Impact **
SELECT C.CategoryName,
	   STUFF((
				 SELECT ', ', + P.ProductName
				 FROM dbo.Products AS P
				 WHERE P.CategoryID = C.CategoryID
				 FOR XML PATH(''), TYPE
			 ).value('.', 'NVARCHAR(MAX)'), 1, 1, '') AS "ProductsList"
FROM dbo.Categories AS C;
GO
--$EndRegion: Normal Stuff Function

--
--$BeginRegion: Alternative to Normal Stuff Function
----> Faster But Applicable from SQL 2017 Only => ** Performance Improvement **
SELECT C.CategoryName,
	   STRING_AGG(ISNULL(P.ProductName, 'N/A'), ',') AS "ProductsList"
FROM dbo.Products AS P
INNER JOIN dbo.Categories AS C
	ON C.CategoryID = P.CategoryID
GROUP BY C.CategoryName;
GO
--$EndRegion: Alternative to Normal Stuff Function

--
--$BeginRegion: Similar to Normal Stuff Function
----> Very Fast Compared to All Above and Less Costly => ** Performance Improvement **
SELECT C.CategoryName,
	   LTRIM(REPLACE(REPLACE(STUFF((
									   SELECT ', ', + P.ProductName AS "xRef" --Dummy ColumnName
									   FROM dbo.Products AS P
									   WHERE P.CategoryID = C.CategoryID
									   FOR XML PATH('')
								   ), 1, 1, ''), '</', '<'), '<xRef>', '')) AS "ProductsList"
FROM dbo.Categories AS C;
GO
--$EndRegion: Similar to Normal Stuff Function

--
--$BeginRegion: CSV String Formation for Assigning to @Variables
DECLARE @CSVstring VARCHAR(MAX);

SELECT @CSVstring = COALESCE(@CSVstring + ', ', '') + P.ProductName
FROM dbo.Products AS P
INNER JOIN dbo.Categories AS C
	ON C.CategoryID = P.CategoryID
WHERE C.CategoryID = 1;

SELECT @CSVstring;
GO
--$EndRegion: CSV String Formation for Assigning to @Variables
